messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Most people think poor countries are in a very bad situation. They believe the people are very poor. They think the countries have bad leaders. And they think there is no hope for a good change.

But this is not true. A big change is happening now. In the last 20 years, many things got better. More than 700 million people have more money. They are not poor anymore.

Also, six million fewer children die from sickness every year. Millions more girls are in school. And millions of people can get clean water.

metadata.feedback_text:
PASS: The text meets all A2 CEFR requirements.
- Factual Integrity: All facts, numbers, and the core message from the original text are accurately preserved.
- Metric Compliance: The MeaningBERT score of 0.8377 and BERTScore of 0.9273 are well above the required thresholds, indicating excellent preservation of meaning and lexical detail.
- CEFR Classification: The text correctly classified as A2.
- Qualitative Analysis: The vocabulary is strictly limited to A1 and A2 levels. Complex concepts like 'governed by dictators' and 'have access to' were correctly simplified to 'have bad leaders' and 'can get'. Sentence structure is consistently short and simple, using only basic A2 connectors like 'and' and 'but'. This is an exemplary A2 text.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Most people think poor countries are in a very bad situation. They believe the people are very poor. They think the countries have bad leaders. And they think there is no hope for a good change.

But this is not true. A big change is happening now. In the last 20 years, many things got better. More than 700 million people have more money. They are not poor anymore.

Also, six million fewer children die from sickness every year. Millions more girls are in school. And millions of people can get clean water.

metadata.feedback_text:
PASS: The text fully complies with the A2 standard.

- Factual Integrity: All facts, numbers, and core messages from the original text have been preserved without error.
- Meaning and Fidelity: The metrics are well within acceptable limits. MeaningBERT score of 0.8377 and BERTScore of 0.9273 confirm that the core meaning and key lexical items were successfully retained.
- CEFR Compliance: The classifier result is correctly A2. The text avoids B1 structures and vocabulary.
- Qualitative Audit: The vocabulary is appropriately restricted to A1 and A2 levels. Complex concepts were effectively simplified into A2 terms (e.g., 'disease' to 'sickness', 'have access to' to 'can get'). Sentence structure is exemplary, utilizing short, simple sentences and basic connectors. The submission meets all requirements of the protocol.
